sentence.text: The various motoring offences can baffle the uninitiated , as I learned to my horror once when on a jury .
In fact , there are very few people I would listen to simply because anything technical about the golf swing baffles me .
This was to baffle the radar , which would be confused by echoes from the dunes , and to hide from the nightfighters .
He was baffled by arithmetic and hopelessly confused by those twin horrors , history and geography .
Yet , when we finally gain the object of our desire , we are baffled by the constant emptiness we still feel .
They admit they are baffled by their findings because they have been unable to discover a common link to all the tragic cases .
The doctor was baffled by his patient 's mysterious illness .
For a moment he was baffled .
Little Graham Harrison has a rare skin condition which has baffled doctors and makes life a constant struggle for him and his parents .
The signalbox at Kirton Lindsey was the subject of an unexplained occurrence that was to baffle everyone for ever .
ENGLAND manager Graham Taylor baffled fans with his team selections and tactical changes in last summer 's European Championship in Sweden .
It baffled even his friends this week when he declined to attend the memorial services for the Solingen victims .
One thing baffles me about that , Lord Wilson : you were Prime Minister , you were the boss , you were presiding over Cabinet government .
` Sub-woofer " is one of the current buzz-terms in the audio world , extensively used by hi-fi salesmen intent on baffling the poor punter with tech-speak .
FOR those baffled by a smoky or cracking chimney , a new free booklet may be able to offer some help .
He would baffle and intrigue her , just as he had done Cassie on their first meeting ; and Cassie could think of no way in which she could explain him away .
One Middlesbrough cinema manager , worried that the title might baffle or mislead his patrons , added a handwritten ` Gold Diggers " to it on the display bills supplied .
